solution_line_template: On the second day, the executive receives {initial_emails_day1}/{half_divisor} = <<{initial_emails_day1}/{half_divisor}={emails_day2}>>{emails_day2} new emails.
On the third day, he receives {emails_day2}/{half_divisor} = <<{emails_day2}/{half_divisor}={emails_day3}>>{emails_day3} new emails.
On the fourth day, he receives {emails_day3}/{half_divisor} = <<{emails_day3}/{half_divisor}={emails_day4}>>{emails_day4} new emails.

Therefore, during the entire trip he will have received {initial_emails_day1} + {emails_day2} + {emails_day3} + {emails_day4} = <<{initial_emails_day1}+{emails_day2}+{emails_day3}+{emails_day4}={total_emails}>>{total_emails} new emails.
